abstract: Two new books examine how digital technologies are transforming businesses and the economy, and look at the resulting ethical and regulatory concerns.
lead_paragraph: The potential of “big data” and “artificial intelligence” to revolutionize business is routinely hailed by everyone from entrepreneurs to executives at established public companies. Many of these claims have elicited increasing skepticism from the public.
keywords: Competing in the Age of AI: Strategy and Leadership When Algorithms and Networks Run the World (Book)
The Business of Platforms: Strategy in the Age of Digital Competition, Innovation, and Power (Book)
